lines.text: Why you keep calling me Jésus? I look Puerto Rican to you?
Guy back there called you Jésus.
He didn't say Jésus. He said, "Hey, Zeus!" My name is Zeus.
Zeus?
Yeah, Zeus! As in, father of Apollo? Mt. Olympus? Don't fuck with me or I'll shove a lightning bolt up your ass? Zeus! You got a problem with that?
No, I don't have a problem with that.

[hands Zeus a gun]
Here take this.
How's it work?
You don't know how to shoot a gun?
Look, all brothers don't know how to shoot guns, you racist motherfucker.
Sue me.
You know how to pick this lock?
Is this some black-shit again?
Hey will you stop that racial shit? Are you a fuckin' locksmith or not?

[to Simon]
I can appreciate your feelings for McClane. But believe me, the jerk isn't worth it. He's stepped on so many toes in this department, by this time next month he's gonna be a security guard. His own wife wants nothing to do with him, and he's about two steps shy of becoming a full-blown alcoholic.

[whispering]
One step, *one* step.
[Zeus and McClane have just stolen a man's car on the highway]

[to man]
Hey! Who was the 21st President?
Go fuck yourself!
[McClane and Zeus are arguing over how to solve the problem]
I'll put my foot up your ass, you dumb, mother...
Say it! Say it!
What?
You were gonna call me a nigger, weren't you?
No I wasn't!
Yes you were! What were you gonna call me?
Asshole! How's that, asshole!
Now, where you goin'?
School.
Why?
To get educated.
*Why*?
So we can go to college.
And why is that important?
To get es-pect.
RE-spect. Now, who's the bad guys?
Guys who sell drugs.
Guys who have guns.
And who's the good guys?
We're the good guys.
Who's gonna help you?
Nobody.
*So who's gonna help you*?
We're gonna help ourselves.
And who do we not want to help us?
White people.
That's right. Now get on outta here. Go to school.
Didn't I hear you say you didn't even like your brother?
There's a difference, you know, between not liking one's brother and not caring when some dumb Irish flatfoot drops him out of a window.
You know this guy Simon we're talking to?
Yeah.
I threw his little brother off the thirty-second floor of Nakatomi Towers out in L.A. I guess he's a little pissed off about it.
Wait a minute. You mean to tell me I'm in this shit 'cause some white cop threw some white asshole's brother off a roof?
[about to call Simon with the answer to another riddle]
No, wait, wait! It's a trick. It's a trick.
What d'you mean?
I forgot about the man.
What man? Fuck the man! We got ten seconds here!
He said, "how many were going to St. Ives," right? The riddle begins, "As I was going to St. Ives, I met a man with seven wives!" The guy and his wives aren't going anywhere.
What are they doing?
Sitting in the fucking road! Waiting on the moor! How the hell should I know?

[to terrorists in a tunnel]
Hi, fellas. Mickey O'Brien, aqueduct security. Hey, listen, we got a report of a guy coming through here with, uh, eight reindeer.
[shoots the terrorists]
Yeah, they said he was a jolly, old, fat guy with a snowy, white beard. Cute little red and white suit. I'm surprised you didn't see him.
Yippie-kai-yay motherfucker.
I'll tell you what your problem is, you don't like me 'cause you're a racist!
What?
You're a racist! You don't like me 'cause I'm white!
I don't like you because you're gonna get me *killed*!
Morning.
Good morning.

You having a nice day, sir? You feeling all right? Not to get too personal, but a white man standing in the middle of Harlem wearing a sign that says "I hate niggers" has either got some serious personal issues, or not all his dogs are barking.
[John yawns]
Hey! I'm talking to you! Now you've got about ten seconds before those guys see you, and when they do they will kill you, you understand? You are about to have a very bad day.
Tell me about it.

[opens door of dump truck]
You're a truck driver?
No I'm a beautician. Of course I'm a truck driver!
Listen, you fail I cover your ass. I fail you cover my ass!
And if we both fail?
Then we're both fucked!
What the fuck are you doin'?
Interrogatin' him.
Well, what's he gonna tell you, "I'm dead"?
Well, I ain't gonna know 'til I ask him, am I?
That guy was pissed.
He'll feel better when he looks in the back seat.
Shit! That was *my* gold bar!

[after realizing that all of the city's cops are busy searching schools for Simon's bomb]
What is it that Wall Street doesn't have?
What, is this shit catching? You're talking in riddles!
No, man, stay with me, what is it that Wall Street doesn't have?
What?
Schools. And what is it they've got a shitload of?
What?

[as McClane answers the pay phone]
"Birds of a feather, flocked together, so do pigs & swine. As nice as their chance as well as I had mine."
Nice. Rhymes.
Why was the phone busy, who were you calling?

[Sarcastically]
The psychic hotline.
I advise you to take this more seriously.
Hey, this is public phone. What do you want me to say?

[Slightly annoyed]
You can simply say that there was a fat woman on it and it took you a minute to get her off.
[Both McClane and Zeus give shocked faces]
Now, there's a significant amount of explosive in the trash receptacle next to you. Try to run, and it goes off now.
We're not going to run, but I got a hundred people out here.

*That's* the point. Now, do I have your attention? "As I was going to St. Ives, I met a man with 7 wives, every wife had 7 sacks, every sack had 7 cats, every cat had 7 kittens, kittens, cats sacks and wives. How many were going to St. Ives? My number is...

[Interrupting]
Woah, whoa wait a minute I didn't get all that. Say it again.
Not a chance. My number is 555 and the answer. Call me in 30 seconds or die.
That's it!
What?
Hillary Clinton. The 42nd President.
Nah, she'd be the 43rd President.
Alright, alright. But who's the 21st President?
I don't know.
You don't know?
No, I don't know! Do you know?
No!
Well?
[McClane removes his shirt and pants]
You know, you're the first woman since Holly to see me do this.
I'm honored.
Yeah, so was she.
[after dropping McClane off in Harlem with a sign that says "I hate niggers"]
We'll be back to pick you up in fifteen minutes.
Take your time. I expect to be dead in four.
[Referring to The Sign of the Cross]
How do Catholics do their thing?
North, South, West, East.
No riddle is gonna stop this motherfucker?
No code, no riddle, no fancy little countdown.

[showing pictures]
Do you recognize this guy?
No.
How 'bout this one?
Mm-mm.
How 'bout you?
[Zeus shakes head]
Did you recognize the voice on the phone?
No.
Did you, uh, notice any cars following you?
No.
Anybody following you at all? Any kind of surveillance, telephone, house, anything unusual at all?
Well, now that you mention it, I have experienced a, you know, like a burning sensation between my toes. I thought it was just some athlete's foot or something.

[talking to police on speaker phone]
Well, is the ebony Samaritan there, now?
You got a problem with ebony?
No, no. My only problem is that I went to some trouble preparing that game for McClane. You interfered with a well-laid plan.
Yeah, well, you can stick your well-laid plan up your well-laid ass.
Don't fuckin' move.

[turns around]
Oh, the Samaritan.
Gimme the goddamn code.
Code?
[realizing what Zeus is talking about]
Oh, you mean for the school. I'm sorry, I can't do that.
You call in that code right now. Or I'll blow your sick ass into the next world.
If that's what you gotta do.
[Zeus pulls the trigger on his gun and nothing happens, Simon takes the gun from Zeus]
You forgot to take the safety catch off.
[shoots Zeus in the leg]
Oh, God!
See, that works. Now, where's McClane?
What the hell's all this got to do with killing McClane?
Life has its little bonuses.
Said Simple Simon to the pieman going to the fair, "Give me your pies... or I'll cave your head in."
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! I'm not going anywhere.
Simon says you got to go.
I'm not jumping through hoops for some psycho! That's a white man, with white problems. You deal with him. Call me when he crosses 110th Street.
Damn McClane, you know I was just starting to like you.
Yeah, well don't, I'm an asshole.
What are you talking about, now?
I lied to you, Zeus.
About what?
You remember, I said Weiss found that bomb up in Harlem?
Yeah.
They found it down in Chinatown.
Oh. Oh, now that's low, even for a white motherfucker like you. That's low.
I told you I was an asshole.
I told you 9th Avenue is the quickest way south.
Stop all the goddamn yellin'! I know what I'm doing.
Not even God knows what you're doing!

[coming in]
A nut who knows a lot about bombs. We found this in a playground. Professional. Very cool stuff. You know...
[thuds the bomb on Cobb's desk]
Boom!
You think you should slam it around like that, Charlie?
It's unmixed. You can't hurt it. This stuff is cutting edge. It's a binary liquid.
A what?
Like epoxi. Two liquids.
[puts a dab of the clear liquid on Cobb's desk]
Now, either one by itself,
[hits it with his shoe]
you got nothing. But, mix them...
[swirls a paper clip in both liquids and throws it at a chair, the mixture explodes violently knocking the chair across the room]

[yelling]
Charlie, you're gonna be wearin' that chair up your ass!

[yelling]
Christ almighty, Charlie!
Like I said very cool stuff. Now, with a package like this, you get a warning. Now, the bomb has to arm itself. You'll see the red liquid pump into the clear before it detonates.
How long before?
Ten seconds, two minutes, it could be anything. But, once it's mixed, be somewhere else.
[trying to get to one of Simon's destinations on time]
I told you the Park Drive is always jammed.
I didn't say "Park Drive."
[McClane turns the cab and drives through the park]
I said "through the park."
If I hadn't've saved your fuckin' ass, I wouldn't be sittin' here with you about to blow up with 100 billion dollars in fuckin' gold.
Yeah, well, I got some bad news, you're only gonna blow up with me.
What?
No gold on this boat.
How do you know that?
Cuz I know the man, I know the family. The only thing better than blowing up 100 billion dollars worth of gold is making people think you did.
[McClane and Zeus break into a car]
You know how to hot-wire this thing?
Of course I can, I'm an electrician. Only problem is...
[Zeus starts the ignition with his pliers]
it takes too fuckin' long.
The name Gruber mean anything to you, lieutenant?
[flashback to Hans Gruber falling from Nakatomi Towers]
It rings a bell, yeah.
[McClane and Targo are fighting]
I see you all day, little man. Policeman.
[Targo kicks McClane, who is on the ground]
And you don't go away.
Yeah, I'm that fucking Energizer bunny.
112 Wall Street.
No wait. This isn't a taxi.
Your lights are on. Look, I'll make this very simple. 112 Wall Street, or I'll have your medallion suspended. What you don't like white people?
112 Wall Street? Got it.
[Zeus rushes into the Wall Street subway station and gets held at gunpoint by a transit cop who saw him jump the turnstiles]

[slowly]
I have to answer that phone.
Get 'em up!
Look, if you have to shoot me, then you go ahead and you shoot me! But I have to answer this phone, all right?

[picks up the receiver]
I'm here.

[on the other line]
And McClane?
He's on his way. Uh, you know, he's a little slow. He's kinda outta shape.
The rules applied to both of you. I'm afraid this is noncompliance. Goodbye.
[Simon hangs up]
Trust me guys. Duck.

[He immediately takes cover, knowing what will happen. As the train enters the station, McClane tries to smash the door on the last car of the train to throw the bomb out onto the track to minimize the amount of damage. As he does that, the wheels on the firts car hit a trip wire on the left rail that is connected to a remote detonator. It activates the bomb as McClane is throwing it out the window, causing the rear car to slide across the island platform, knocking down signs and columns]
[last lines]
Oh, shit.
What? *What*?
I left Holly hanging on hold.
Ah, call her back.
Uhh, she's gonna be pissed.
She'll get over it.
I don't know, Zeus. Like I said, she's a very stubborn woman.
She'd have to be to stay married to you.

Simon says, McClane and the Samaritan will go to the subway station at 72nd and Broadway. I will call you in 15 minutes on the payphone outside the station. No Police. Failure to answer will constitute noncompliance. Do you understand me, John?
Oh, yes, I understand. I understand that you're a fuckin' wacko who likes to play kids' games. That's what I understand.
Hardly.

[imitating Simon]
Hahdly? Well, then, who are you? Somebody I sent up? What'd you do? Shoplifting? Purse-snatching?
[pauses and puts hand over the receiver]
Cross-dressing? What?
You c-c-c-couldn't catch me if I stole your ch-ch-chair with you in it!
My ch-ch-ch-chair with me in it? That's very exciting. Let me ask you a question, bonehead. Why are you trying to k-k-k-k-kill me?
So what's up with this L.A. thing? You famous or something?
Yeah, for about five minutes.
Don't tell me. Rodney King, right?
Fuck you.
Is there a detective named McClane there?
He's on suspension.
No, Walter, he's not. Not today.
Who is this?
Call me Simon.
What do you want?
I want to play a game.
What kind of game?
"Simon Says". Simon's going to tell Lt. McClane what to do, and Lt. McClane is going to do it. Noncompliance will result in a penalty.
What penalty?
Another big bang in a very public place.
Why me? What does he got to do with me?
I have no idea, he just said it had to be you.
It's nice to be needed.
This thing got airbags?
Your side does, I don't know about mi-
[shouts]
McClane!
Excuse me, sir, but I'm expecting a call. I need that phone.
Why don't you use the other phone?
Sir, please. I need to use that phone.
Hey, listen, bro, I was here first.
Bro? Get away from the goddamn phone!
Yo, partner! Wait up.
Hey, hey, hey, hey, I ain't your partner. I ain't your neighbor, your brother, or your friend. I'm your total stranger.
They want you to know who's doing it to you. So this name Simon is probably not an alias. It's probably Simon or some variation.

[reading a rap sheet]
Simon, Robert E. Busted in '86. Extortion. Kidnapping. 10 to 15. Did 7 years for good behavior. Released on a state work furlough two months ago.
Check it.

[Rick tosses something to John]
Thanks, Rick. Bob Simon was a bankrupt businessman who kidnapped his partner's daughter. He's a fuck-up, not a psycho. The guy we're looking for is nuts.
Next, fourteen dumptrucks stolen from a yard in Staten Island. Fourteen! Jesus! Somebody starting a construction company?
No, it was John's landlady, gonna clean his apartment.
Think we should call a fire truck?
Aw, fuck 'em. Let 'em cook!

[disgusted, upon seeing McClane's torn and bloodied clothing]
Are you all right?
Yeah, it's laundry day.
[McClane and Zeus are speeding through Central Park]
Are you aiming for these people?
No. Well, maybe that mime.
Oh, boy... am I glad you talked me out of jumping.

[talking to Simon on the phone]
He's here.
Perhaps you could be a little more specific.
She told me to stay on the line.
[laughs]

[laughs]
Oh, God, I love this country!
You know, your brother was an asshole.

[pauses]
Ha!
You know, he really was an asshole.
He was. He was an asshole. You... you got his number.
I'm a soldier, not a monster. Even though I sometimes work for monsters.
I think he's dead my dear.
[Simon is in one of the dumptrucks driving gold through the unfinished aqueduct]

[on a phone]
Rear guard, you can close up now.
[pauses, not getting an answer]
We've reached the dam, you can come up now.
[pauses again]
Nils? You can close in now. Nils?

[on the guard's phone]
Attention! Attention! Nils is dead! I repeat, Nils is dead, fuck-head. So's his pal, and those four guys from the East German All-Stars, your boys down at the bank? They're gonna be a little late.

[on the phone]
John... in the back of the truck you're driving, there's 13 billon dollars worth in gold bullion. I wonder would a deal be out of the question?

[on the phone]
Yeah, I got a deal for you. Crawl out from that rock you're hiding under, and I'll drive this truck up your ass.

[on the phone]
How colorful.
Yesterday we were an army with no country, tomorrow, we have to decide which country we want to buy!
Say hello to your brother.
Bonwit Teller. Who the hell would wanna blow up a department store?
Did ya ever seen a woman miss a shoe sale?

[the second guard tries to reach the front desk but instead reaches Simon's henchman who has replaced the real guard]
Front desk.
Yes, call the police, get your ass down here right now! I'm under attack!
Hey, just relax mate, maybe you'll live through this.

[Not believing this, the guard promptly grabs a shotgun and fires relentlessly at the door. He doesn't see Katya creep up behind him with a knife. She slashes through his neck twice, then stabs him in the chest, causing him to double over. As he doubles over, she stabs him in the back, at which point Simon grabs her, twists her hand and pins her against the wall, restraining her. He glowers disapprovingly at her]
I think he's dead, my dear.
I had no idea Canada could be this much fun.

[addressing his troops]
And remember, this is all due to the g-g-g-g-g-g-gullibility of the New York Police Department!

[Simon, disguised as a City Engineer, surveying the damage caused by one of his bombs]
Holy Toledo! Somebody had fun.
No guts. No glory.
[Weiss is hardwiring the bomb in Chester A. Arthur Elementary School]
Six booby traps, four dead ends, "and a Partridge in a pear tree." Okay, honey. Let's dance.

[Simon has just broken into the Federal Reserve]
One hundred and forty billion dollars! Ten times what's in Kentucky. Fort Knox? Ha! It's for tourists.
It's Christmas. You could steal City Hall.
Come on.
[Zeus and John take the kids' bikes]
My bike?
Let's go. Come on.
That's my bike!
Yeah, it's Christmas!
[Targo's beaten John up, he scrambles away]
Where are you going, now? You going to arrest me, bunny? Huh?

[sees chain on ground]
I don't think I'm gonna arrest-
[grabs chain]
I'm gonna fuckin'-
[uses chain to knock Targo out]
Yo, uncle!
Come look at this!

[looks at watch]
It's ten after nine. Why aren't you in school?
Tony wants to sell you this.
Tony? That no-neck dude they call "Bad T"?
He says he found it in a dumpster.
He keeps stealing from people, they're gonna find him in a dumpster.
No, he didn't steal it. He says his uncle gave it to him.
Mm-hm? Hand me that newspaper over there.
[Raymond hands Zeus the paper, and he whaps his nephews' heads lightly]
Don't *ever* let people use you. You're running all over town with stolen property; if you get caught, you get in trouble while he gets to deny the whole thing and walk away.
Y-You mean, you want us to take it back to Tony?
No, I'll take it back to Tony... with a message.

Hi kids. I know you usually have assembly on Fridays, but today's special. Mr. Lambert here is from the fire department and today he wants us to practice a brand new fire drill. So, I want you to divide in half, and I want half of you to go over here - teachers will help them - and line up against the wall. The other half will go in this direction. Please do it very quietly and very quickly, alright? Everybody up please. Teachers, please help them.
Fire drill, my ass. That guy ain't from the fire department.
Maybe it's cuz of the radio.
You mean, like, they're after us? Nah.
Tony squealed on us!
No he didn't.

[in German]
Nicht schiessen!

[shoots him]
What was that?

[kicks McClane]
He said "Don't shoot!"
Have you been drinking, McClane?
No, not since this morning.
[about to jump onto a subway train]
This is a bad idea.
McClane is a toilet bug.

[puzzled, he whispers]
A toilet bug?
[Simon's last line]

[panicking]
Get out of here!

As I was going to St. Ives, / I met a man with seven wives. / Every wife had seven sacks, / Every sack had seven cats, / Every cat had seven kittens. / Kittens, cats, sacks, wives, / How many were going to St. Ives?
Hang on, we're going down.
Do you see those high-tension wires?
Hey, McClane, what the fuck!
Listen to me. Hang the fuck on, all right?
Hot in here, or am I just scared to death?
Money is shit to me. I would not give up McClane for all the gold in your Fort Knox.
Where are my pigeons now?
Pigeons?
I had two pigeons, bright and gay, fly from me the other day. Why was it they did go? You cannot tell, you do not know.
You mean McClane?
No, I mean Santa Claus.
Yes, I was saying that we're dealing with a megalomaniacal personality with possible paranoid schizo...
Hey, hey! How 'bout we just skip down to the part where you tell me what the fuck this has to do with me, huh?
Dial 911. Tell the police to get up here quick. Somebody's about to get killed. And get your butts to school, you hear me?

[casually]
Yeah.
Yeah.
Hey dickhead! Did I come at a bad time?

[to Zeus]
This guy doesn't care about skin color. Even if you do.

[helicopter being shot at by Simon]
Oh, shit!
Oh, shit!
What do you mean, "Oh, shit"?
[Simon and Targo have just learned that McClane killed two of their henchmen at the aqueduct]
I told you not to toy with him!
Thank you, that's very helpful.
What the hell's it doing now?
It's mixing.

[Zeus has picked up a stray gold ingot and attempts to carry it out with him]
Put that shit down.
No fuckin' way.
They ain't gonna let you keep it.
Yeah, yeah, we'll see.

[angrily]
It's my lucky fuckin' day!

I want you to get a hold of a guy named Cobb. Walter Cobb. C-o-b-b. He's the head of my police unit. Get him down here. Find him. Tell him you were with John McClane. And tell him to find out who the 21st president was.
Chester A. Arthur.
What?
Chester A. Arthur. 1881 to 1885. Nominated vice-president in 1880. Did you know he was Collector of Customs right here in New York?

[smiles]
No, I didn't know that, Jerry. Take care of yourself.
Who do you think you are? Hillary Clinton?
